other_tests.findings: Within the gallbladder, there are many stones with significant shadowing. The anterior gallbladder wall appears to be within normal limits without surrounding pericholecystic fluid or significant thickening. The liver is normal in shape and contour with normal echogenicity. No focal hepatic lesions. The main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 4 mm.
